turn.speaker: sidney_m_glazer
turn.label: Mr. Sidney M. Glazer
turn.text: When I find out that a presentence investigation had been made, that the Court had read it, and then the Court pronounced sentence.

turn.speaker: thurgood_marshall
turn.label: Justice Thurgood Marshall
turn.text: But you -- I don't see where you were cut off.

turn.speaker: sidney_m_glazer
turn.label: Mr. Sidney M. Glazer
turn.text: “Custody of the martial.”

turn.speaker: thurgood_marshall
turn.label: Justice Thurgood Marshall
turn.text: That cut you off.

turn.speaker: sidney_m_glazer
turn.label: Mr. Sidney M. Glazer
turn.text: Maybe if --

turn.speaker: thurgood_marshall
turn.label: Justice Thurgood Marshall
turn.text: I see.

turn.speaker: hugo_l_black
turn.label: Justice Hugo L. Black
turn.text: You mean that if you -- if you were to add more to read that -- wanted to see that thing, you wouldn't have asked him?

turn.speaker: sidney_m_glazer
turn.label: Mr. Sidney M. Glazer
turn.text: At this time, we were so surprised --

turn.speaker: hugo_l_black
turn.label: Justice Hugo L. Black
turn.text: Well, why wouldn't you?
Would you let him cut you off that quickly?

turn.speaker: sidney_m_glazer
turn.label: Mr. Sidney M. Glazer
turn.text: We were so surprised that a presentence investigation had been made --

turn.speaker: hugo_l_black
turn.label: Justice Hugo L. Black
turn.text: Well, that's right, but did you ask him to see it?
Why didn't you ask him to see it?

turn.speaker: sidney_m_glazer
turn.label: Mr. Sidney M. Glazer
turn.text: Because the --

turn.speaker: earl_warren
turn.label: Chief Justice Earl Warren
turn.text: Maybe the last paragraph of the colloquy would clear that up.

turn.speaker: hugo_l_black
turn.label: Justice Hugo L. Black
turn.text: I've just read it.
It didn't clear it up to me.

turn.speaker: earl_warren
turn.label: Chief Justice Earl Warren
turn.text: Mr. Richards: “Your Honor, I would like to ask that a presentence investigation be made of --" and then the Court interrupting, “a presentence investigation has been made.
It is before me now, and I've read it.
It shows the juvenile record.

It shows that, in 1960, this defendant stole an automobile in violation of the Tire Act, was given indeterminate youth commitment sentence, his was paroled in 1965, he was returned -- no, he was paroled in 1962, returned as a parole violator in 1965, and was not released full time until May of last year.
I am also informed that he was convicted of robbery in Yuma, Arizona and given from 7-10 years.
Several warrants are now pending against him for robbery of which he is charged.
It will be the judgment of this Court that this defendant be sentenced of the mandatory 25 years, custody of the martial.”
To me, that's plain interruption and a lack of opportunity for the counsel even to answer the Court because when he said “custody of the martial,” it was all over.

turn.speaker: hugo_l_black
turn.label: Justice Hugo L. Black
turn.text: Do you believe that a lawyer who represents his client from the beginning to the end could be stopped from talking by what was said there?

turn.speaker: sidney_m_glazer
turn.label: Mr. Sidney M. Glazer
turn.text: At this time --

turn.speaker: hugo_l_black
turn.label: Justice Hugo L. Black
turn.text: Would you?

turn.speaker: sidney_m_glazer
turn.label: Mr. Sidney M. Glazer
turn.text: No.

turn.speaker: earl_warren
turn.label: Chief Justice Earl Warren
turn.text: He was the lawyer.

turn.speaker: hugo_l_black
turn.label: Justice Hugo L. Black
turn.text: Would you stop from talking with what was --

turn.speaker: sidney_m_glazer
turn.label: Mr. Sidney M. Glazer
turn.text: It certainly was not, except the defendant --

turn.speaker: hugo_l_black
turn.label: Justice Hugo L. Black
turn.text: Did you want to see it?

turn.speaker: sidney_m_glazer
turn.label: Mr. Sidney M. Glazer
turn.text: Did I want to see the presentence investigation?

turn.speaker: hugo_l_black
turn.label: Justice Hugo L. Black
turn.text: Yes.

turn.speaker: sidney_m_glazer
turn.label: Mr. Sidney M. Glazer
turn.text: At that time, no.
The defendant turned, walked away in the custody of the martial.

turn.speaker: earl_warren
turn.label: Chief Justice Earl Warren
turn.text: You mean after this colloquy was over?

turn.speaker: sidney_m_glazer
turn.label: Mr. Sidney M. Glazer
turn.text: Yes.
The defendant -- the marital stepped forward.
The defendant was taken from the courtroom immediately.
Then, we were later brought back and he was advised of his appellate rights some minutes later, 10-15 minutes later, after I had left to get my car started from the parking lot.
Then, we were brought back in the courtroom and advised of the appellate rights that the petitioner had.

turn.speaker: byron_r_white
turn.label: Justice Byron R. White
turn.text: Well, what were you going to say that you didn't get to say?

turn.speaker: sidney_m_glazer
turn.label: Mr. Sidney M. Glazer
turn.text: At that time, I had nothing to say, Your Honor.

turn.speaker: byron_r_white
turn.label: Justice Byron R. White
turn.text: Well, no.
When the judge interrupted you there when you asked a presentence report be made, what were you going to say that you didn't get to say?

turn.speaker: sidney_m_glazer
turn.label: Mr. Sidney M. Glazer
turn.text: I was requesting that a presentence investigation be made.
Mr. Gregg -- this was --

turn.speaker: potter_stewart
turn.label: Justice Potter Stewart
turn.text: That's something --

turn.speaker: sidney_m_glazer
turn.label: Mr. Sidney M. Glazer
turn.text: This was all about --

turn.speaker: potter_stewart
turn.label: Justice Potter Stewart
turn.text: That's something which you sought would take a little time and the sentence would be put off until it was completed.
That's what you were after, weren't you?

turn.speaker: sidney_m_glazer
turn.label: Mr. Sidney M. Glazer
turn.text: That's correct, and I was --

turn.speaker: potter_stewart
turn.label: Justice Potter Stewart
turn.text: And said of which you discovered, I gather that it's something you didn't know, that it'd already been done so you couldn't get a delay in sentence while pre-investigation.

turn.speaker: sidney_m_glazer
turn.label: Mr. Sidney M. Glazer
turn.text: That's correct.
I was not going to ask that the report be destroyed --

turn.speaker: hugo_l_black
turn.label: Justice Hugo L. Black
turn.text: Are you sure you're not asking a leading question instead of stating what you thought?

turn.speaker: sidney_m_glazer
turn.label: Mr. Sidney M. Glazer
turn.text: No, Your Honor, I believe I am.
Thank you.

turn.speaker: william_j_brennan_jr
turn.label: Justice William J. Brennan, Jr.
turn.text: Are you leading question or not?

turn.speaker: sidney_m_glazer
turn.label: Mr. Sidney M. Glazer
turn.text: At this time, I was not going to ask.
I was only asking that a presentence investigation be made and I was not going to ask that it be disclosed to the petitioner or his counsel.
Thank you.

turn.speaker: earl_warren
turn.label: Chief Justice Earl Warren
turn.text: Very well.
